answers.answer: Hi,There maybe something going on other than diabetes if your blood sugar is well controlled.I don't know if there is possible side effects of your meds that could contribute.  maybe you could discuss all of them with a pharmacist - they tend to know more abotu drugs and drug interactions than most doctors.Ask your doctors to check thryoid function.  Low thyroid can contribute to feelling cold.Just some ideas.  Hope this helps.

question: I have Diabetes but Im diet controlled..... In May of this year I flew to Seattle, WA .....While in the air my legs  started to feel cold it felt like there was ice cold air blowing on back of my legs.....My sweather Coat plus 3  bankets could not keep me warm...This continued From Philadelphia, PA  to  Ohio when I got off the plane the frezzing started to leave my legs....I had a stop over in Cleaveland then I boarded another plane to Seattle while in the air the same thing happened again freezing legs...When I arrived in Seattle and  we landed the coldness left again .. I did not mind it again untill I was on the plane again on the way to another stop over in Houston,TX   once on the ground my legs stated to feel better... Then on the way to Philadelphia, PA it happened again this time when we landed the coldness did not leave my legs... About 1 week after I was back home the coldness started to move up my legs to my arms and shoulders this has been going on almost 6 month now  I have been researching  this on the internet but no luck ......My meds are Amlodipine...Simvastatin....Lisinopril.....Lyrica....Femara....Zolpidem  the only way Im not freezing is when Im sleeping....It can be 80 degrees in my house and Im still cold ....In July I had Kidney Stones and had to go to the Hospital  while there I was freezing so bad that the nurses put 10 blankets on me and I was still cold.....
title: Can Anyone Hepl me
